definition: to gain a firm foothold/(fig.) to get oneself established
station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
sentences.chinese: 確認你的起點無慮，然後站穩腳步。
